# Release Template

Use this template for every package release to improve discoverability on npm and GitHub.

## Summary

One paragraph with the user-facing outcome:
- What problem is easier to solve now?
- Who benefits from this release?

## Highlights

- Added:
- Improved:
- Fixed:
- Deprecated:

## Upgrade Notes

- Breaking changes:
- Migration steps:
- Runtime/version requirements:

## Package Changes

- `@batchactions/core`:
- `@batchactions/import`:
- `@batchactions/distributed`:
- `@batchactions/state-sequelize`:

## SEO/Distribution Checklist

- [ ] Release title includes package + outcome (for example: `@batchactions/import: faster CSV preview pipeline`)
- [ ] Changelog language includes searchable terms (`bulk import`, `csv import`, `batch processing`, `distributed workers`, `typescript`)
- [ ] Root and package README examples still match the API
- [ ] npm package pages show updated version, description, and keywords
- [ ] Shared post prepared for X/LinkedIn/Discord/Reddit with one runnable snippet
